subject: Climate & Environment
title: Agricultural Ammonia
description: A quick win: understand Agricultural Ammonia.

hook.text: Farms produce a pollutant you rarely hear about: ammonia. And it is everywhere.

buildup.text: Livestock waste and synthetic fertilizers release ammonia gas into the air constantly.

discovery.text: Ammonia reacts with other pollutants in the atmosphere to form fine particulate matter.

twist.text: In parts of Europe, farming is the single biggest source of PM2.5 â€” more than traffic.

climax.text: Reducing ammonia is tricky because it means changing how billions of animals are fed and housed.

punchline.text: The farm next door may pollute your air more than the highway.

quiz.question: What does ammonia form when it reacts with other pollutants?
